oauth.description: Settings related to the oauth authentication provider

views.description: Settings related to the Views Feature

docPropagation.description: Settings related to the documentation propagation feature

homePage.description: Global settings related to the home page for an instance

applications.description: Settings related to applications. If not enabled, applications won't show up in navigation

SsoSettings.description: SSO Integrations, supported on the UI.

clientId.description: Unique client id issued by the identity provider.

clientSecret.description: Unique client secret issued by the identity provider.

userNameClaim.description: ADVANCED. The attribute / claim used to derive the DataHub username. Defaults to "preferred_username".

userNameClaimRegex.description: ADVANCED. TThe regex used to parse the DataHub username from the user name claim. Defaults to (.*) (all).

scope.description: ADVANCED. String representing the requested scope from the IdP. Defaults to "oidc email profile".

clientAuthenticationMethod.description: ADVANCED. Which authentication method to use to pass credentials (clientId and clientSecret) to the token endpoint: Defaults to "client_secret_basic".

jitProvisioningEnabled.description: ADVANCED. Whether DataHub users should be provisioned on login if they do not exist. Defaults to true.

preProvisioningRequired.description: ADVANCED. Whether the user should already exist in DataHub on login, failing login if they are not. Defaults to false.

extractGroupsEnabled.description: ADVANCED. Whether groups should be extracted from a claim in the OIDC profile. Only applies if JIT provisioning is enabled. Groups will be created if they do not exist. Defaults to true.

groupsClaim.description: ADVANCED. The OIDC claim to extract groups information from. Defaults to 'groups'.

extractJwtAccessTokenClaims.description: ADVANCED. Whether to extract claims from JWT access token.  Defaults to false.

preferredJwsAlgorithm.description: ADVANCED. Which jws algorithm to use. Unused.

preferredJwsAlgorithm2.description: ADVANCED. Which jws algorithm to use.

OAuthSettings.description: Trust oauth providers to use for authentication.

OAuthProvider.description:
An OAuth Provider. This provides information required to validate inbound
requests with OAuth 2.0 bearer tokens.

enabled.description: Whether this OAuth provider is enabled.

name.description: The name of this OAuth provider. This is used for display purposes only.

jwksUri.description: The URI of the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) endpoint for this OAuth provider.

issuer.description: The expected issuer (iss) claim in the JWTs issued by this OAuth provider.

audience.description: The expected audience (aud) claim in the JWTs issued by this OAuth provider.

algorithm.description:
The JWT signing algorithm required for this provider.
Prevents algorithm confusion attacks. Common values: RS256, RS384, RS512, PS256, ES256

userIdClaim.description:
The JWT claim to use as the user identifier for this provider.
Different providers use different claims (sub, email, preferred_username, etc.)

defaultView.description: The default View for the instance, or organization.

config.description: The configuration for the feature, in JSON format.

configVersion.description:
The version of the configuration schema that has been used to serialize
       the config.
If not provided, the version is assumed to be the latest version.
